heading: shooting rampage
subheading: neighbors of an alleged gunman say he shot and killed two men and critically injured three others near pittsburgh on wednesday because they were white. police say the suspect, identified as 39-year-old ronald taylor, killed a maintenance man at his apartment in the town of wilkinsburg, pennsylvania. taylor, who is black, then allegedly set fire to the residence before walking to a commercial area armed with a .22 calibre pistol and a knife, shooting the four others and taking hostages -- some in wheelchairs -- at a nearby office complex. he surrendered about four hours later. police aren't speculating on a motive.
author: wired staff
